title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as the Short Title. Definitions are provided in Section 2. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Arts Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges as defined in section 2(a)(4) of the Tribally Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978. Tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions are defined in the Tribally Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990. SEC. 3. Land grant status for tribally controlled community colleges and tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions. Land grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, shall be considered land-grant colleges. Applicability of related provisions includes any provision of any Act of Congress relating to the operation of, or provision of assistance to, a land-grant college in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of. The applicability of related provisions includes any provision of any Act of Congress relating to the operation of, or provision of assistance to, a land-grant college in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, or the Northern Mariana Islands shall apply to the land-grant colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) in the same manner and to the same extent. Authorization of appropriations in lieu of extending to the colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) those provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, relating to donations of public land or land scrip for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts. Authorization of appropriations in lieu of extending to the colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) those provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, relating to donations of public land or land scrip for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts. Appropriations of $10,000,000 are authorized to be granted to tribal colleges and institutions. Amounts appropriated pursuant to this section shall be held and considered to have been granted to such colleges and institutions subject to the provisions of that Act applicable to the proceeds from the sale of land or land scrip. The Act titled "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993" defines the term used in the legislation. The "1994 Institutions" as defined in the Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993 include various colleges such as Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, and others. The list of tribal colleges and universities includes Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, and others. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts. They are subject to provisions of Acts of Congress related to land-grant colleges, with exceptions for agricultural research funding under specific Acts. In lieu of extending provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862 to 1994 Institutions, $23,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for them. This funding is subject to the provisions of that Act applicable to the proceeds from the sale of land or land scrip. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include funding for 1994 Institutions. Section 3 of the Act of May 8, 1914 is also amended. The Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 allocated annually for specified purposes. The funds will be distributed through a competitive application process to State institutions. The Act of May 8, 1914 is amended to authorize appropriations for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 allocated annually for specified purposes. Funds will be distributed through a competitive application process to State institutions without a matching requirement. SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture and sciences through matching grants. $1,700,000 is authorized for grants for fiscal years 1995 through 1999. The Research Facilities Act is amended to provide $1,700,000 in grants for 1994 Institutions for construction, acquisition, and remodeling of research buildings and laboratories in agriculture and sciences from 1995 to 1999. The title is amended to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
